event.title: 1854, a church and convent was built

data.event: In 1854, a church and convent was built by Father Peter La Cour near the town's present site.

event.title: 1878 when Charles Lander Cleveland, a local judge, donated

data.event: The town began forming in 1878 when Charles Lander Cleveland, a local judge, donated 63.6 acres (257,000 m2) of land to the Houston East & West Texas Railway (now part of the Union Pacific Railroad) for use as a stop, requesting that the town be named for him.
The town was not incorporated until 1935.

event.title: services to the community, and the Texan Theater and the annual livestock show and rodeo, Dairy Days

data.event: The Austin Memorial Library Center offers a wide range of services to the community, and the Texan Theater and the annual livestock show and rodeo, Dairy Days, provide entertainment.

event.title: is reflected by the fact that in 1965

data.event: The general trend toward urbanization of the entire area is reflected by the fact that in 1965 Liberty County was added to the Houston Standard Metropolitan Statistical Area.
The population of Cleveland grew from 1,200 in 1930 to 7,605 according to the census of 2000.
